text: [CLS] title : comprehensive asthma management protocol source : international respiratory health organization author : irho asthma guidelines committee date : 2024 - 01 - 15 type : clinical guideline asthma classification and management severity classifications : intermittent symptoms a ‰ ¤2 days / week nighttime awakenings a ‰ ¤2x / month normal fev1 between exacerbations fev1 > 80 % predicted persistent mild : symptoms > 2 days / week nighttime awakenings 3 - 4x / month fev1 a ‰ ¥80 % predicted moderate : daily symptoms nighttime awakenings > 1x / week fev1 60 - 80 % predicted severe : symptoms throughout day frequent nighttime awakenings fev1 < 60 % predicted treatment steps : rescue medications low - dose inhaled corticosteroids medium - dose ics + laba high - dose ics + laba add - on biologics consideration [SEP]

[CLS] title : chronic kidney disease management guidelines source : international nephrology association author : ina guidelines committee date : 2024 - 02 - 20 type : clinical guideline ckd staging and management disease staging : stage 1 : egfr a ‰ ¥90 ml / min / 1. 73ma² stage 2 : egfr 60 - 89 ml / min / 1. 73ma² stage 3a : egfr 45 - 59 ml / min / 1. 73ma² stage 3b : egfr 30 - 44 ml / min / 1. 73ma² stage 4 : egfr 15 - 29 ml / min / 1. 73ma² stage 5 : egfr < 15 ml / min / 1. 73ma² management protocol : risk factor control blood pressure management glycemic control lipid management lifestyle modification complications management anemia bone mineral disorders cardiovascular disease malnutrition [SEP]

[CLS] title : clinical practice guidelines for type 2 diabetes management source : world health organization guidelines repository author : who diabetes expert committee date : 2024 - 01 - 15 type : clinical guideline comprehensive guidelines for type 2 diabetes management diagnostic criteria primary diagnostic tests fasting plasma glucose ( fpg ) a ‰ ¥ 126 mg / dl ( 7. 0 mmol / l ) 2 - hour plasma glucose a ‰ ¥ 200 mg / dl ( 11. 1 mmol / l ) during ogtt hba1c a ‰ ¥ 6. 5 % ( 48 mmol / mol ) random plasma glucose a ‰ ¥ 200 mg / dl with symptoms risk factors assessment family history of diabetes obesity ( bmi a ‰ ¥ 30 kg / ma² ) physical inactivity age a ‰ ¥ 45 years hypertension ( a ‰ ¥140 / 90 mmhg ) dyslipidemia treatment protocol initial management lifestyle modifications metformin ( if not contraindicated ) blood glucose monitoring hba1c target < 7 % treatment escalation first - line : metformin second - line options : sulfonylureas dpp - 4 inhibitors sglt2 inhibitors glp - 1 receptor agonists monitoring schedule hba1c every 3 - 6 months annual comprehensive foot examination annual eye examination regular cardiovascular assessment [SEP]

text: [CLS] title : essential hypertension management protocol source : cdc cardiovascular health division author : cdc hypertension task force date : 2024 - 02 - 01 type : clinical guideline hypertension management guidelines blood pressure classification normal : < 120 / < 80 mmhg elevated : 120 - 129 / < 80 mmhg stage 1 : 130 - 139 / 80 - 89 mmhg stage 2 : a ‰ ¥140 / a ‰ ¥90 mmhg hypertensive crisis : > 180 / > 120 mmhg diagnostic evaluation required testing multiple bp measurements comprehensive metabolic panel lipid profile urinalysis 12 - lead ecg serum creatinine treatment protocol first - line medications : ace inhibitors / arbs calcium channel blockers thiazide diuretics lifestyle modifications : sodium restriction ( < 2000 mg / day ) dash diet regular physical activity weight management [SEP]

[CLS] title : understanding type 2 diabetes : patient guide source : national institute of diabetes education program author : nidep patient education team date : 2024 - 01 - 30 type : patient education living with type 2 diabetes what is type 2 diabetes? type 2 diabetes occurs when your body cannot properly use insulin or doesn ' t make enough insulin. this causes glucose to build up in your blood instead of being used for energy. common symptoms : early signs increased thirst and urination unusual hunger unexplained weight loss fatigue blurred vision daily management blood sugar monitoring : learn target ranges regular testing schedule record keeping healthy eating : carbohydrate counting portion control meal timing healthy food choices [SEP]

text: [CLS] title : living with high blood pressure : a comprehensive guide source : national heart health education initiative author : nhei patient resources team date : 2024 - 02 - 10 type : patient education understanding high blood pressure what is blood pressure? blood pressure is the force of blood pushing against your artery walls. high blood pressure occurs when this force stays high over time. key topics : understanding your numbers systolic pressure ( top number ) diastolic pressure ( bottom number ) target ranges risk factors lifestyle changes diet modifications : reducing salt intake dash diet principles heart - healthy eating alcohol moderation physical activity : types of exercise safe activity levels monitoring during exercise [SEP]

text: [CLS] title : understanding heart disease : patient information guide source : cdc heart health division author : cdc patient education committee date : 2024 - 02 - 15 type : patient education heart disease : what you need to know understanding heart disease heart disease includes various conditions affecting your heart and blood vessels. the most common type is coronary artery disease, which can lead to heart attack. key information : warning signs chest pain or discomfort shortness of breath upper body discomfort nausea, lightheadedness cold sweats risk factors controllable : high blood pressure high cholesterol smoking obesity physical inactivity uncontrollable : age gender family history prevention strategies regular exercise heart - healthy diet stress management regular check - ups medication adherence [SEP]
